title: european sans serif
author: henriboy

comments.content:
Similar to Interstate Mono, but not quite:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate-mono/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060211/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate-mono/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate-mono/")

The top part of the b is smaller than the bottom, which makes it unusual....
I think the N is the key - that bit of straight shaft at the bottom right is what I can not find

Pragmata Pro is also close (has the right style N, J, and numerals, but the X and A are off):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/pragmata+pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060211/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/pragmata+pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/pragmata+pro/")
Edmonsans it is, except for the numerals.
Good find Ryuk - I bet the numerials are from another font
